title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/20/2023 INC#0473

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0473; 09:16AM; 963 W 43rd Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41b2QWz; #VermontSquare; Firefighters found a large single-family home with fire showing and heavy pressurized smoke coming from the vents. Crews ascended ladders to ventilate the roof, as companies made entry with hose lines to fight the fire from the interior. It took 57 firefighters 21 minutes to extinguish the flames. There were 7 civilian patients found. Two were transported in critical condition by firefighter-paramedics, while the other 5 declined transport after being evaluated on scene. One firefighter was transported in fair condition for minor smoke inhalation. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E15 E21 E215 E221 E229 E233 E33 E46 E57 E66 EM1 EM11 EM13 PH1 RA10 RA14 RA17 RA246 RA25 RA33 RA46 RA64 RA66 RA9 RA94 SQ21 T15 T21 T29 T33; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0473; 08:55AM; 4311 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3lUCCYc; #VermontSquare; One-story single-family home with heavy fire showing. Reports of multiple patients. Offensive mode.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E215 E233 E46 E57 E66 RA246 RA46 SQ21 T15 T33; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0296; 06:48AM; 820 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z620sE; #Westlake; Firefighters arrived to find an out building on fire, spreading to a two-story living space (guest house? accessory dwelling unit?). 54 Firefighters split their efforts to extinguish both structures in 24 minutes. Firefighters found one occupant in the living quarters and evacuated him. As a precaution, firefighter-paramedics did a full assessment and found him to be in good condition, with no need for treatment or transport. No injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E203 E209 E210 E211 E215 E220 E229 E29 E89 E9 EA1 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA803 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T20 T29 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0296; 06:24AM; 820 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z620sE; #Westlake; Detached garage with fire showing, exposing a nearby home to flames. Offensive mode. ; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E13 E203 E209 E210 E211 E215 E220 E229 E29 E89 E9 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA803 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T20 T29 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Traffic Collision; INC#0730; 12:36PM; 2030 S Sawtelle Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kb5hId; #Sawtelle; One vehicle collided with a parked car and a dumpster in front of a restaurant on Sawtelle Blvd. A total of 4 patients were transported to the hospital (20F critical, 74M moderate, 24F fair, and 61M fair). No further information regarding circumstances of the collision/patients. LAPD Inc #1936.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 BC9 E237 E292 E43 E69 EM14 EM9 RA37 RA59 RA68 T37 T92; CH4; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0584; 10:48AM; 1598 Bienveneda Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/3I6kFxi; #PacificPalisades; Firefighters assisted an adult female with an ankle injury, unable to make it back to her vehicle. Firefighter/paramedics treated her and LAFD Air Ops transported her by air to a local hospital due to the remote location of the trail where the injury occurred in Temescal Canyon. Nothing further.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP23 E23 E263 H2 H3 HA2 HA3 RA23 RH114 T63; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0365; 07:53AM; 721 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z4yvHq; #DowntownLA; Firefighters responded to a five-story building with smoke showing from the second floor. Firefighters made entry and located one unit containing fire on the second floor, which had filled the floor with smoke. 48 Firefighters extinguished the flames in 23 minutes and will continue to utilize blowers to systematically remove smoke and reintroduce fresh air into the building. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation. LAPD Inc #1075.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E20 E209 E210 E211 E215 E227 E3 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM13 HR3 RA11 RA3 RA4 RA9 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T27 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 14 15; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0365; 07:30AM; 721 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z4yvHq; #DowntownLA; Five-story building (hotel?) with moderate smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E210 RA11 SQ21 T10 T9; CH9; 14; Nicholas Prange

Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#1469; 06:54PM; 11950 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; PRELIM: Two vehicle collision. No entrapment. Three patients total: one adult (undetermined age/gender) deceased and remains at scene. One elder female in serious condition and one adult male in fair condition, both to area hospitals by LAFD Paramedics. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #3319) and Coroner.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E298 EM15 RA75 RA898 RA91 T98; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Fatality Vehicle Fire; INC#0753; 11:23AM; 13799 W Jefferson Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xvIvOn; #PlayaDelRey; PRELIM: LAFD arrived quickly to the scene of a reported vehicle fire to discover a burning motorhome parked on the road shoulder. During fire extinguishment, a lifeless adult male was discovered in the vehicle. Beyond medical help, he was determined deceased and remains at the scene. No other injuries reported. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. Media Inquiries: LAPD Pacific Division (Incident #1670) and Coroner.; FS 67; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; AR1 BC4 E62 E67 RA5; CH7; Brian Humphrey
